question.text: State which of these statements about blood groups (ABO system and Rh system taken together) is correct.

options.text: The blood group having all the possible antigens present in these two systems is the universal recipient
The blood group considered as the universal donor is also the commonest blood group in humans
The blood group considered as the universal recipient is also the rarest blood group in humans
The blood group having no antibodies against any of the antigens in these two systems is the universal donor

solution.text: Universal donor: O Rh-ve, Commonest blood group in humans: O Rh+ve. Universal recipient: AB Rh+ve, Rarest blood group in humans: AB Rh-ve. The possible antigens considering ABO system and Rh system are Antigen A, Antigen B and Antigen Rh. A blood group having all the three antigens is AB Rh+ve and it is the universal recipient. A blood group having no antibodies has all the antigens and that too is AB Rh+ve.
